title: [IOTDB-3983] Recover wal file's metadata
[IOTDB-3927] Remove useless log in cross space compaction
body:
See details in [IOTDB-3927](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=492&projectKey=IOTDB&view=detail&selectedIssue=IOTDB-3927&quickFilter=2202).
When no files can be selected in the cross space compaction, it is not because the memory exceeds the threshold, but the seq files or unseen files are being occupied by other compaction tasks. 
In addition, even if the memory exceeds the threshold, at least one group of unseq file and its overlapping seq files will be selected.

title: Extract ISchemaTree interface
body:
## Description

### Motivation
The original schemaTree is designed for cluster mode operations, including schema info transport and merge.

For standalone mode, we don't need to construct and initialize schemaTree objects for query and insertion. The best way is to use LocalConfigNode and SchemaEngine to implement a StandaloneSchemaTree, which requires few extra memory usage.
 
### Modification

Thus we extract an interface ```ISchemaTree```, which defines the necessary schema info query methods. 
The original schemaTree is renamed to ```ClusterSchemaTree```.

### Future work
For standalone mode, we will implement ```StandaloneSchemaTree```.

title: Influxdb service adapts to distributed MPP framework and fixes some bugs in InfluxFunction and TagInfoRecord
body:
## Background
The existing InfluxDB service does not adapt to the new distributed MPP framework. I developed a new InfluxDB service that adapts to the new distributed MPP framework without affecting the original influxDB service.

## Different
### added some new classes
 - **AbstractInfluxDBMetaManager**: manages the mapping of tags->path, provides template methods, and subclasses only need to implement abstract methods
   - **InfluxDBMetaManager**: An existing implementation class that uses ServiceProvider to perform physical planning.
   - **NewInfluxDBMetaManager**: An implementation class adapted to the MPP framework, which uses ClientRPCServiceImpl to process read and write requests.
- **AbstractQueryHandler**: handles query requests, provides template methods, and subclasses only need to implement abstract methods.
   - **QueryHandler**: Existing implementation class, which uses ServiceProvider to process the read physical plan
   - **NewQueryHandler**: An implementation class adapted to the MPP framework, which uses ClientRPCServiceImpl to process read requests.
- **InfluxDBSeviceImpl**: The existing influxDBRPCSevice instance.
- **NewInfluxDBSeviceImpl**: an instance of influxDBRPCSevice adapted to the MPP framework.
Detailed class diagrams and designs：https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/doxcnZzEZ1BwXS6EQfrUEuGOX4d#doxcnO2Kue0WCMog6En9LtAJEJh
### fixed some bugs
the classes involved：
- **TagInfoRecords**：This class is used to write the sequence of each tag into IoTDB. At present, there may be multiple adjacent tags with the same timestamp, which causes the tags written later in IoTDB to overwrite the tags written before.
- **InfluxMeanFunction**：The type of the incoming parameter is double, but the type of the member variable sum is long, resulting in a type mismatch exception
- **InfluxFirstFunction and InfluxLastFunction**：There is a problem with the logic. The existing implementation reverses the logic of last and first, and the result of the calculation is null.

title: [IOTDB-3191][IOTDB-3192] Refactoring sync module to use AbstractSyncInfo to manage pipe metadata
body:
### Overview

This pr modifies the sync architecture on the old standalone version to reduce the coupling of the individual component pieces. The old execution process will be replaced with a new one and adapted for distribution later. 

A comparison of the current architecture with the future architecture is illustrated below.
![架构](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43774645/181417674-cdab9d8a-c08f-4d7d-b73f-8ee581d0ca3b.jpeg)


### Common

* Extracting sync configuration to nodes-common
  * `sync_dir`
* Move some Utils and Constants to nodes-common
  * `SyncConstant.java`
  * `SyncPathUtil.java`
  * `SyncPipeUtil.java`

### Pipe

* Merge the former `ReceiverLog` and `SenderLogger` into a `SyncLogger`, with sync metadata managed by `AbstractSyncInfo`, which will be placed on Confignode in the future.
* Extract PipeInfo from Pipe. The original pipe has information and behavioural responsibilities, confignode only needs to manage the information in the Pipe.
* The architecture on the receiving end has been refactored.
  * The receive no longer maintains the pipe metadata, so some of the rpc has been removed.
  * Asynchronous loading have been changed to synchronous loading, there is no need to use PipeDataQueue at the receiver.
  * Note: *show pipe* is currently not supported on the receiver, it will be supported in the next PR.

title: [To rel/0.13][IOTDB-3969]Fix timeseries statistic bug
body:
## Description

### Problem
When delete storage group, the timeseries represent by template will be counted and the result will be used to update the timeseries statistic number. The number doesn't update when activate template. Thus the number will be negative.

### Solution
Use two number to statistic template series and normal series separately.

title: [IOTDB-3781] Reinforce the regionCleaner task's startup logic
body:
The regionCleaner task in ConfigNode's PartitionManager will start as soon as the PartitionManager is initialized, which is unsafe however. Ever interior ScheduledExecutor should not be started until the current ConfigNode confirms it's leadership. And these inner ScheduleExecutor should be shutdown immediatly when the current ConfigNode loses it's leadership.

Test result, all ScheduledExecutor started after the current ConfigNode becomes leader:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33111881/181195354-480bb8a5-f980-443c-9eb6-39ac2121b27a.png)

### Metrics are added when the heartbeat service is started and deleted when the heartbeat service is stopped.

### These metrics include the total number of online and unknown nodes, And the survival status of each node.

config_node{name="EndPoint(0.0.0.0:22277)",status="1:online,0:unkonwn",} 1.0
#### The total number of registed nodes is represented by registed.
data_node{name="total",status="registed",} 1.0
config_node{name="total",status="registed",} 1.0
#### The total number of online nodes is represented by online.
data_node{name="total",status="online",} 2.0
config_node{name="total",status="online",} 2.0

title: [To rel/0.13] [IOTDB-3813] Remove access to meta manager in compaction
body:
See [IOTDB-3813](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-3813).
The reason we need to shutdown CompactionManager when we shutdown IoTDB is that, compaction threads access to meta manager during compaction. When the IoTDB shuts down, the meta manager will be terminated, at which time compaction threads may throw exception. If we remove the access to meta manager, the exception will not be thrown, and we need not to interrupt compaction threads when IoTDB shutdown.

title: [To rel/0.13] [IOTDB-3943] Optimize session timeout feature
body:
## Description
Users may forget to close sessions. Such idle connections lead to a waste of server resource and in the worst case, take up all the memory of server. Session timeout is trying to solve such problem.

https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/3483

Currently this feature has other problems

Once the session is cleared by session timeout, the client will not get the status, when client tries to use the session again, server will throw NPE. We should throw connect exception here to client, so that session pool can catch it and uses another session to connect.
Metric module will insert data to IoTDB, we need to consider use session pool in this module.

see IOTDB-3894

### Cause

The last value was cached in the measurementMNode inside template, which means different timeseries represented by one template shared the same measurementMNode instance and this mistakes the last cache value.

### Solution

Since the template is only used as one level, the measurementMNode instance will be cloned and returned for last query and last cache execution.

In this PR, I support `clear cache` in new cluster.

Clear the cache of chunk, chunk metadata, timeseries metadata and bloom filter to release the memory footprint.

In cluster mode, we must consider the distinction between requests to clear the cache of a single node or the entire cluster.

The syntax definition look like:
```CLEAR CACHE (ON (LOCAL | CLUSTER))?```

title: [To rel/0.13][IOTDB-3777]Avoid holding sg write lock in the whole processin of deletion
body:
**Description**
1. The write lock of sg is held during the entire deletion process (including serializing mods), resulting in "fake death" when multiple delete operations are concurrently performed.
2. When there is a flushing memtable, no matter whether the data meets the conditions, the mods will be serialized after the memtable is successfully flushed.

**Improvements**
1. In the deletion process, in order to avoid the concurrent problem of writing and memory data deletion, it is necessary to add a write lock to the data deletion of the unsealed file, while the data deletion of the sealed file, that is, serializing mods, does not need to add a write lock. 
2. For data deletion of unsealed tsfiles, it is necessary to check whether there is a device containing the data to be deleted in its resource, and whether the time range overlaps.

title: [IOTDB-3777]Avoid holding sg write lock in the whole processin of deletion
body:
**Description**
1. The write lock of sg is held during the entire deletion process (including serializing mods), resulting in "fake death" when multiple delete operations are concurrently performed.
2. When there is a flushing memtable, no matter whether the data meets the conditions, the mods will be serialized after the memtable is successfully flushed.

**Improvements**
1. In the deletion process, in order to avoid the concurrent problem of writing and memory data deletion, it is necessary to add a write lock to the data deletion of the unsealed file, while the data deletion of the sealed file, that is, serializing mods, does not need to add a write lock. 
2. For data deletion of unsealed tsfiles, it is necessary to check whether there is a device containing the data to be deleted in its resource, and whether the time range overlaps.
